results.title: Electricity
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Addresses the fundamentals of electrostatics and current electricity, helping students to form images of abstract concepts. The first three programs on electrostatics explains the charging of objects by contact and induction. The last three episodes on current electricity looks at electrical charge, current flow, potentail difference and resistance.

results.title: Electrical safety in the workplace
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Looks at the effects and potential hazards associated with electricity, including definitions of basic terms, facts about how electricity is conducted and the effects of electrical currents on the human body. It identifies common hazards found in the workplace including overhead power lines, damp locations and the use of extension cords, as well as the importance of insulation and wearing appropriate personal protective equipment. Presented by Peter Mitchell.

results.title: Einstein: the story of the man by his friends
results.brief_description: A biographical documentary dealing with the life and work of Albert Einstein using historical footage and interviews with friends and colleagues. The film explores Einstein’s childhood, education, work, migration and political beliefs. His theories are explained using simple, unscientific terms. Tragically, despite his pacifism, Einstein’s work was instrumental in the creation of the atomic bomb. Includes footage of Einstein with Charlie Chaplin, at a ceremony in his honour hosted by George Bernard Shaw, visiting California between the wars and receiving a Nobel prize. It also contains historical footage of the World Wars including the burning of books by the Nazi party and attacks on Jewish homes and businesses. Narrated by John Stockbridge. Photographed by Eugene Carr, Len Newson and Tony Leggo. Edited by Ted Walter.

results.title: Eight out of ten
results.brief_description: In its appeals, the American Cancer Society has found that eight out of ten people will give money if properly approached. Here is shows how the successful first appeal of the Arizona section was run; from the recruiting of chairman and leaders, through publicity and education, to the vital face-to-face method of appeal.

results.title: Eggs
results.brief_description: This film deals with the mass-production of eggs for commercial marketing, and illustrates the technological devices used to speed up the output of eggs per day. Correct feeding and care of the hens in the laying houses, the gathering of eggs from both open and trap nests, the cooling and automatic handling, grading, cleaning, and packing of the eggs for the market are studied.

results.title: Efftee entertainers
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film provides footage of the earliest Australian stage acts to appear on sound films. These long forgotten ‘shorts’ open a window on the Australian Variety and Show world of the 1930’s. Footage includes famous local comics, singers and dancers: Stan Ray, George Moon, Minnie Love and Keith Desmond.

results.title: Effective office communication: trainers manual [text]
results.brief_description: The manual which accompanies program of the same title contains a transcript of the dramatised episode which highlights problems with office communication and outlines some strategies to improve it. Each section of the text gives a brief introduction to the topic and presents a discussion exercise for consideration. Topics include: purposeful communication, the two-way process of communication, planning and establishing regular communication practices, the value of written communication, confidentiality, follow-up communication and using praise to motivate. The video tape may be borrowed as a separate loan item.
